channel.title: 317, 508 or 525+?
channel.description:
Hello i have been wondering what should i use of 317, 508 or 525+? What do u use and why do u use it. And why dont u use the other?
Personaly i had a 508 but found out its verry unstable so im thinking of change to 317 again or maybe 525+?

item.title: 317, 508 or 525+?
item.dc:creator: @sonicforce41 sonicforce41
item.description:
@sonicforce41 wrote:

hey um… i say 317 because more int and models are being made for 317 than any other base… btw i can’t play on 317 client idk why, it crashes on me!

Read full topic

item.title: 317, 508 or 525+?
item.dc:creator: @watch_n_lern watch n lern
item.description:
@watch_n_lern wrote:

I recommend starting with a 317. They are definitely more stable. There is also more knowledge known about them, and they are easier to code if you are a beginner. Also 508s+ are still fairly new so they are more unstable, while 317s are older and easier to code. I suggest a 317 because there are still some really good 317s out there and they are getting better.

Read full topic

item.title: 317, 508 or 525+?
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

569 servers is what the real runescape is currently up to… i’m waitin for one to be released for us ^^

Read full topic

item.title: 317, 508 or 525+?
item.dc:creator: @Pika1 Pika_
item.description:
@Pika1 wrote:

Most leechers go with delta, so it’s your best chance0(not calling you a leecher). I mean really, the server status page is like 90%+ delta, 4% cammy/lumby/dyanor pvp, 2% all-star/czar, 4% other.

Read full topic

item.title: 317, 508 or 525+?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Stick with one version, don’t bother changing every time a new one is released. 317 or 508, not 525 because it is to unstable IMO.

Read full topic

item.title: 317, 508 or 525+?
item.dc:creator: @mister_schmister mister_schmister
item.description:
@mister_schmister wrote:

Iam not realy new just made a comeback 2 years later.
When i was 12 i coded 317 cause ther realy wasent anything else.
Now iv started to get feeling for 508s and i think theyr easy to code.
Not to brag but i have a real ease to learn coding(its my big love in life)
Iam still trying 508-525s:/
Iam trying to find a stable source:/
Thanks for all help:D

Some1 got a good stable source for 508-525+?

Read full topic

item.title: 317, 508 or 525+?
item.dc:creator: @Rich_Dude99 Rich Dude99
item.description:
@Rich_Dude99 wrote:

I reccomend you start with 317, and since you seem to be new. Stick to it, understand it. If you feel ready, move on. But let me tell you that 508’s, and 525’s are layed out and programmed in a completely different way.

Me? I am just sticking to 317, and really I don’t think I ever plan on moving on.

Read full topic

item.title: 317, 508 or 525+?
item.dc:creator: @Sage_Mode Sage Mode
item.description:
@Sage_Mode wrote:

You should do 525, 508s are extremely glitchy and unstable, 317s, can be easily haxed and crashed, they are DECENT though so maybe 525 or 317. IF YOU SEE ANYTHING ABOUT 503s 516s, 564 or some unheard of number DONT get it! Extremely hard to code, especially if you do not understand 508 or 525.

Read full topic

item.title: 317, 508 or 525+?
item.dc:creator: @Fluffee Fluffee
item.description:
@Fluffee wrote:

If you think 508 is unstable - then you should do 317. It’s easier to learn (: I also switched from 508 to 317 most recently.

Fluffee

Read full topic
